org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common

Interface Field

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventField

    public interface Field
    This interface defines specification (getters, setters, maintenance methods) for fields to be used in audit events.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the content of the field's value.
      char[] getCharValue(String stringEncoding)
      Get the value of the field as an (encoded) char[].
      Field getCopy()
      Create a copy of the field.
      Encodings getEncoding()
      Get an indication on whether the binary data returned by getValue() represents a encoded data, and would have to be encoded e.g.
      String getName()
      Get the name of the field.
      byte[] getValue()
      Get the value of the field.
      void setValue(byte[] value)
      Set the value of the field.
      void setValue(byte[] value, Encodings encoding)
      Set the value of the field, indicating the encoding that has been used on the data represented by the value of this field.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name of the field.

        This name is set, for instance, when the field is created.

        Returns:
        The name of the field

      • setValue

        void setValue(byte[] value)
        Set the value of the field.

        This method sets the encoding to Encodings.PLAIN (i.e. unencoded).

        See setValue(byte[], Encodings).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set

      • setValue

        void setValue(byte[] value,
              Encodings encoding)
        Set the value of the field, indicating the encoding that has been used on the data represented by the value of this field.

        Note that, depending on the implementation, the value of the field may always be internal represented as binary data, with this binary data being a binary representation of a plain text string, or a binary representation of a hex-encoded string that represents some non-printable binary data.

        When the encoding is set to a different value than Encodings.PLAIN, consumers of the field information (e.g. processors) should attempt to decode the value of this field before further processing.

        Note that implementations of this method should create a defensive copy of the provided value), and store the copy in the field. You need to explicitly clear the data provided to this method if it contains confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        encoding - The encoding that was used to produce the data in the byte[] array

      • getValue

        byte[] getValue()
        Get the value of the field.

        Use the getEncoding() method to get an understanding if the value returned by this method represents an unencoded or an encoded byte array, and what decoding mechanism would have to be used to restore the plain value.

        Returns:
        The value of the field.

      • getCharValue

        char[] getCharValue(String stringEncoding)
        Get the value of the field as an (encoded) char[].

        Use the getEncoding() method to get an understanding if the value returned by this method represents an unencoded or an encoded char array, and what decoding mechanism would have to be used to restore the plain value.

        Parameters:
        stringEncoding - The String encoding to use when converting the byte value to a char value (e.g. UTF-8)
        Returns:
        The value of the field as an (encoded) char[].

      • getEncoding

        Encodings getEncoding()
        Get an indication on whether the binary data returned by getValue() represents a encoded data, and would have to be encoded e.g. for display.
        Returns:
        The recommended encoding for the value of this field.

      • getCopy

        Field getCopy()
        Create a copy of the field.

        All elements of the field are copied into a new instance, which is returned to the caller.

        Returns:
        A copy of the field

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the content of the field's value.

        This method overwrites the internal representation of the field value in the instance. Use this call to wipe potentially confidential information from memory.
